newsitem.title: BELGIUM: Grain panel seeks to encourage malt exports.
newsitem.headline: Grain panel seeks to encourage malt exports.

text.p: The cereals management committee abolished a negative corrective on malt exports applicable from October, EU sources said on Friday.
The negative corrective was equivalent to the value of the export refund.
"The EU wants to encourage more exports as they have been quiet in recent weeks," the source said after a weekly meeting of the committee on Thursday.
The committee approved a regulation to import 2,800 tonnes of compound animal feed at a reduced tariff, the sources added.
The tariff quota is under GATT Article 24.6.
The committee is expected next week to approve another GATT reduced tariff quota. It will be for 1,000 tonnes of broken rice to be used in baby food.
